Course Learning Outcomes: <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; URL=noscript.html">METU | Course SyllabusCourse Learning OutcomesBy the end of the semesters, students are expected toHave an understanding of some psychological theories and concepts that are relevant to game designBe able to analyze and design games from the perspective of these theoriesBecome aware of academic research possibilitiesRealize how these concepts are related to their personal life, and discover more about themselves and others
Course Content: Students will read the weekly assigned articles and write reaction papers reflecting on the potential applications to game design. These papers will be double spaced and no more than 2 papers long. The psychological concepts will be clarified in the classroom and students are expected to actively participate in class discussions about potential applications. As the term project, the students will either evaluate a commercial game based on the theories learned in the course and present it in class, or present an innovative way to apply of these concepts in game design. The project will be completed individually or in groups based on the number of students taking the course.
